job_title: Special Collections Librarian in Marietta, OH
pros: The college treats its employees well and there is plenty of freedom to work independently and pursue projects of interest. Plus, the city of Marietta is super cute.
cons: The only con is the location. The city is adorable, but if you're into big city living, it will be an adjustment.

job_title: Physician Assistant Faculty in Marietta, OH
cons: They don't pay market value for a PA.

review_title: Overall a good role to gain experience in the events industry.
pros: You get a lot of experience and exposure to all different types of events.
cons: Workflow is varied. When you are in busy season (summer months) it is not stop, and then the fall and winter are rather slow.

pros: Facilities and Community is great. STEM programs are a nice education
cons: Faculty is disconnected and are out of touch with today's student and where higher ed is going. Key positions on campus are not currently doing their job at a high level

review_title: Homelike environment but room for improvement
cons: The pay and room for advancement

pros: Benefits are good for the area

review_title: It was only good for awhile.
pros: The vacation and leave time is the best perk of the job.
cons: Terrible communication across offices which causes a lot of duplicated work. They recently cut retirement benefits.

pros: Overall good colleagues to work with
cons: Unsupportive and toxic work environment. Hard work is never recognized.

pros: Good pay, decent benefits great colleagues
safe, friendly, great students, small community
cons: Remote location, airport is 2 hours away

review_title: Very Positive experience working there, because I had a good relationship with my boss and the people in my department.
pros: Great benefits, including tuition remission or yourself or family members, and access to great athletic facility.  Beautiful campus, generally the faculty and staff are nice, and the work environment is pretty laid back.  Very good work/life balance.
cons: The pay is significantly below market rate, but the benefits are great and the cost of living is low so depending on your priorities that might make up for it.  The town is starved for culture, particularly good food, and is close to several highly-polluting factories.  Not much opportunity for advancement.

job_title: Student Information Specialist in Marietta, OH
pros: Students, faculty, and most of the staff are friendly and supportive.
cons: At-will employer is just that. You will be dismissed from your position without notice and without the ability to defend yourself. If you apply, make sure that your application is complete and without omissions.

pros: Excellent community, great colleagues. They have a strong petroleum engineering program so you get an interesting mix of students. Small class sizes.
cons: No union, little response from administration, general feeling that administration values dollar signs and appearance over education and substance. The town is a bit isolated. Currently downsizing.

pros: Good work environment, great administration. Competitive salary, and also great benefits including free admission to the rec center and tuition remission.
cons: A lot of lay offs currently, no raises in almost six years since the financial crisis. Other than that its mostly positive
